qas.question: What even occured during Bush's presidency that made him become a wartime president?
How long into Bush's presidency did tragedy occur on American soil?
Did Bush become disfavorable during the time of the 9/11 attacks?
How long did it take for the US military to respond by infiltrating Afghanistan?
By which month, were the Taliban no longer controlling Kabul?
How long had Osama Bin Laden been planning the Sept. 11th attack?
How successful was the coalition in its mission in Afghanistan?
How long did it take to capture Osama Bin Laden?
What city had been ruled by Osama Bin Laden?
What happened in New York after the Sept. 11th terrorist attack?

context: Just <a1_0><b5_0>eight months<b5_0/><a1_0/> into his presidency, the <a0_0>terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001<a0_0/> suddenly transformed Bush into a wartime president. Bush's approval ratings <a2_0>surged to near <b6_0>90%<b6_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0>Within <b7_0>a month<b7_0/><a3_0/>, the forces of a coalition led by the United States entered Afghanistan, which had been sheltering Osama bin Laden, suspected mastermind of the September 11 attacks. By <a4_0>December<a4_0/>, the Taliban had been removed as rulers of <b8_0>Kabul<b8_0/>, although <b9_0>a long and ongoing reconstruction<b9_0/> would follow, severely hampered by ongoing turmoil and violence within the country.
